science.text: A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance'. These pink birds get their color from eating shrimp and algae rich in carotenoids.
Honey never spoils. Archaeologists have found edible honey in Egyptian tombs that is over 3,000 years old.
Quantum entanglement allows particles to instantaneously affect each other regardless of distance. Einstein called this phenomenon 'spooky action at a distance'.
The human brain contains approximately 86 billion neurons, each connected to thousands of others, creating over 100 trillion neural connections.
Water can exist in three states simultaneously at its triple point: 0.01°C and 611.657 pascals of pressure.

history.text: The Great Wall of China is not visible from space with the naked eye, despite popular belief. This myth has been debunked by astronauts.
Cleopatra lived closer in time to the Moon landing (1969) than to the construction of the Great Pyramid of Giza (2580 BC).
The shortest war in history lasted only 38-45 minutes. It was between Britain and Zanzibar in 1896.
Napoleon Bonaparte was actually average height for his time at 5'7". The myth of his short stature came from British propaganda.
The Library of Alexandria gradually declined over several centuries rather than being destroyed in a single catastrophic event.

nature.text: Trees can communicate with each other through underground fungal networks called mycorrhizae, sharing nutrients and warning signals.
A single cloud can weigh more than a million pounds, but it floats because the water droplets are dispersed over a huge area.
Bananas are berries, but strawberries aren't. Botanically, berries must have seeds inside their flesh.
Some plants can count. The Venus flytrap counts the number of times trigger hairs are touched before closing its trap.
The Amazon rainforest produces about 20% of the world's oxygen and absorbs massive amounts of carbon dioxide daily.

space.text: One day on Venus (243 Earth days) is longer than its year (225 Earth days). Venus rotates very slowly on its axis.
Jupiter's Great Red Spot is a storm that has been raging for at least 400 years and is larger than Earth.
Neutron stars are so dense that a teaspoon of neutron star material would weigh about 6 billion tons on Earth.
There are more possible games of chess than atoms in the observable universe (approximately 10^120 vs 10^80).
Saturn would float in water if there was an ocean large enough, as it's less dense than water.

technology.text: The first computer bug was an actual bug. Grace Hopper found a moth trapped in a Harvard Mark II computer in 1947.
WiFi technology was invented by accident while trying to detect mini black holes. The failed experiment led to wireless internet.
The Internet was originally called ARPANET and was designed to survive nuclear attacks by having no central point of failure.
Moore's Law predicts that computer processing power doubles every two years, and it has held true for over 50 years.
Quantum computers use qubits that can exist in multiple states simultaneously, potentially solving certain problems exponentially faster.

animals.text: Octopuses have three hearts and blue blood. Two hearts pump blood to their gills, while the third pumps to the rest of the body.
Dolphins have names for each other. They develop unique whistle signatures that function like names in human society.
A shrimp's heart is located in its head, and they have transparent blood due to a different oxygen-carrying protein.
Elephants can 'hear' with their feet. They detect seismic vibrations through specialized cells in their feet and trunk.
Tardigrades can survive in space. These microscopic animals can withstand extreme radiation, temperature, and the vacuum of space.

geography.text: Australia is wider than the Moon. The Moon's diameter is 3,400 km, while Australia measures about 4,000 km from east to west.
Mount Everest grows about 4 millimeters taller each year due to tectonic plate movement pushing the Himalayas upward.
The Pacific Ocean is larger than all land masses combined. It covers about 46% of Earth's water surface.
Antarctica is technically a desert. It receives less than 200mm of precipitation annually, making it the world's largest desert.
The deepest point on Earth, the Mariana Trench, could fit Mount Everest with 2 km to spare above its peak.

culture.text: The word 'quiz' was invented in 1780 by a Dublin theater manager who bet he could introduce a new word into the language within 24 hours.
In Japan, it's considered rude to blow your nose in public, but it's perfectly acceptable to slurp your noodles loudly.
The longest place name in the world has 85 letters: Taumatawhakatangihangakoauauotamateaturipukakapikimaungahoronukupokaiwhenuakitanatahu, a hill in New Zealand.
Chocolate was once used as currency by the Aztecs. Cacao beans were so valuable they were often counterfeited.
The tradition of wearing white wedding dresses started with Queen Victoria in 1840. Before then, brides wore their best dress in any color.

mathematics.text: The number π (pi) has been calculated to over 31 trillion decimal places, but we only need 39 digits to calculate the circumference of the observable universe to the accuracy of a hydrogen atom.
Zero was invented in India around the 5th century. Before this, there was no way to represent 'nothing' mathematically.
A googol is a 1 followed by 100 zeros. A googolplex is 1 followed by a googol zeros - a number so large it can't be written out.
The Fibonacci sequence appears everywhere in nature: flower petals, pinecones, seashells, and even galaxy spirals follow this pattern.
There are more possible arrangements of a deck of 52 cards than there are atoms on Earth. The number is approximately 8×10^67.

food.text: Carrots were originally purple. Orange carrots were developed by Dutch farmers in the 17th century to honor the House of Orange.
Chocolate chip cookies were invented by accident in 1938 when Ruth Wakefield ran out of baker's chocolate and used broken pieces of Nestlé chocolate.
Honey is the only food that never expires. Its low moisture content and acidic pH create an environment where bacteria cannot survive.
Tomatoes were once thought to be poisonous by Europeans because wealthy people got lead poisoning from eating them off pewter plates.
Vanilla is the second most expensive spice in the world after saffron. It takes 300-600 hand-pollinated vanilla flowers to produce just 1 kg of vanilla.

general.text: Your smartphone has more computing power than all of NASA had when they put humans on the moon in 1969.
Humans share about 60% of their DNA with bananas and about 96% with chimpanzees, showing our connection to all life on Earth.
The human eye can distinguish between approximately 10 million different colors, but some women may see up to 100 million colors due to a genetic variation.
Time moves slower at your feet than at your head due to gravitational time dilation. The difference is tiny but measurable with atomic clocks.
The plastic tips on shoelaces are called aglets. The word comes from the Old French 'aguillette' meaning needle.
